Uses of Class
tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives.AbstractSrcDirective

  • Packages that use AbstractSrcDirective 
    Package Description
    tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives  
    tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives.impl  

    • Uses of AbstractSrcDirective in tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives

      Subclasses of AbstractSrcDirective in tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AbstractUnsafeDirective
      The AbstractUnsafeDirective is a base class for script-src and style-src that uses the 'unsafe-inline' or 'unsafe-eval' which also use the nonce and hash source values.

    • Uses of AbstractSrcDirective in tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives.impl

      Subclasses of AbstractSrcDirective in tophersmith.security.headers.csp.directives.impl 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  BaseUriDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The base-uri directive restricts the URLs that can be used to specify the document base URL.
      class  ChildSrcDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The child-src directive governs the creation of nested browsing contexts as well as Worker execution contexts.
      class  ConnectSrcDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The connect-src directive restricts which URLs the protected resource can load using script interfaces.
      class  DefaultSrcDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The default-src directive governs the default src-list of other directives.
      class  FontSrcDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The font-src directive restricts from where the protected resource can load fonts.
      class  FormActionDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The form-action directive retricts which URLs can be used as the action of HTML form elements.
      class  FrameSrcDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The frame-src directive restricts from where the protected resource can embed frames.
      class  ImgSrcDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The img-src directive restricts from where the protected resource can load images.
      class  MediaSrcDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The media-src directive restricts from where the protected resource can load video, audio, and associated text tracks.
      class  ObjectSrcDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The object-src directive restricts from where the protected resource can load plugins.
      class  ScriptSrcDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The script-src directive restricts which scripts the protected resource can execute.
      class  StyleSrcDirective
      From https://www.owasp.org/index.php/Content_Security_Policy_Cheat_Sheet}
      The script-src directive restricts which styles the user may applies to the protected resource.
